Question: If you are the driver and hurt somebody in a crash, who must you report it to?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: You are driving on a country road at night when your vehicle headlights suddenly go out. What is the safest thing to do?

Answers.Answer: Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle hazard lights on
Slow down and drive on the far left side of the road
Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle’s interior lights on
Slow down, move off the road gradually, stop and turn your vehicle hazard lights on

Question: What is the safest way to drive up to intersections?

Answers.Answer: At such a speed that you can stop if you have to

Question: Which person can legally stop and do a roadside check of your vehicle?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
On a Transit Lane sign, what does T2 mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles that use the lane must have at least two people.
Vehicles that use the lane must have two passengers
Only two vehicles are permitted on the transit lane at any time
There are two transit lanes ahead

Question: What is the maximum distance a load may extend in front of a car?

Answers.Answer: 2 metres from the front edge of the front seat
3 metres from the front edge of the front seat
4 metres from the front edge of the front seat
5 metres from the front edge of the front seat

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 100km/h unless the road is clear
A rest area is 100 metres ahead

Question: You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There is loose gravel on the road that could break your windscreen
There is broken glass on the road

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
To tow a trailer on a restricted driver licence, the weight of your vehicle plus the weight of the trailer and its load must not exceed what weight?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
How close may you park your vehicle to an intersection where no broken yellow lines have been marked?
What must you do when you see blue and red flashing lights behind you?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Slow down and drive on carefully

Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: If you have a learner licence you can carry passengers if your supervisor is in the back seat.
What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
A medical doctor, other crash party, a police officer
A police officer, a medical doctor or an approved person
An ambulance driver, an approved person or a medical doctor

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

Question: Alcohol slows down your reactions when driving.
If you are a driver involved in a crash, what is the FIRST action you should take?

Answers.Answer: Stop and place a warning triangle at the side of the road
Drive past at 20km/h until you pass the site of the crash
Stop and check to see if anyone is hurt
Tell a police officer as soon as possible

Question: What is the least distance of clear road you MUST have in front of you when you have finished passing another vehicle?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign
You may park your vehicle for no longer than 40 minutes from 8am to 6pm on days other than public holidays
You may park your vehicle for longer than 40 minutes if someone stays in it
You may not park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign
